newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - Bunds to bounce then dip to test 101.42.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Bunds to bounce then dip to test 101.42.

text.p: Technical indicators suggest Bund futures may enjoy a short term bounce on Monday to the 102.00 area, before falling back to test support around 101.42, analysts said.
"Daily stochastics look pretty bad but the 30 minute charts are improving suggesting we could get a short term bounce," said Elizabeth Miller, technical analyst at Deutsche Morgan Grenfell.
"Short term we could get to around 102.05, then we should come off to test 101.42 channel support."
By 0650 GMT, the June Bund future on LIFFE was down two basis points at 101.85.
Trade was expected to be thin with German markets closed for a public holiday.
Miller said an initial prop at Friday's low of 101.65 would slow any fall before the 101.42 channel support.
Below that, retracement support at 101.24 will kick in, she said. This is the 38.2 percent retracement of the rally from the April 3 low of 99.05 to the May 14 high of 102.59.
On the upside, above 102.05 next resistance is at 102.20, said Miller. "But I don't think we'll get that high today."
Analysts at Chase here said as long as the contract stabilised above 101.71 it would resume its medium term uptrend.
"But in order to reduce short term selling pressure, it has to move above 102.10, while an Elliott buy signal will be triggered on a break of 102.37," they said in a note for clients.
By 0707 GMT, September Euromarks were unchanged at 96.74.
